skill.name: AgentDB Vector Search
skill.description: Implement semantic vector search with AgentDB for intelligent document retrieval, similarity matching, and context-aware querying. Use when building RAG systems, semantic search engines, or intelligent knowledge bases.
skill.summary: Implement semantic vector search with AgentDB for intelligent document retrieval, similarity matchin...
skill.author: ruvnet

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides instructions for using AgentDB vector search. It contains no executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond documentation, and no external commands. The skill is purely educational and poses no security risks.

content.user_title: Build Lightning-Fast Semantic Search with AgentDB
content.value_statement: Traditional databases struggle with semantic search queries. AgentDB delivers 150x faster vector operations with sub-millisecond search times for building intelligent RAG systems and knowledge bases.
actual_capabilities: Store and search vectors with sub-100¬µs latency using HNSW indexing
Reduce memory usage by 4-32x through quantization (binary, scalar, product)
Perform hybrid searches combining vector similarity with metadata filtering
Batch insert 100 vectors in 2ms with 500x performance improvement
Support multiple distance metrics: cosine, euclidean, dot product
limitations: Requires Node.js 18+ and AgentDB v1.0.7+ installation
Needs OpenAI API key or custom embedding model for text vectorization
Database must be initialized with correct vector dimensions for your model
Performance benefits require proper HNSW indexing configuration

use_cases.title: Build RAG Systems
use_cases.description: Create retrieval-augmented generation pipelines that find relevant context from large document collections in milliseconds.

use_cases.title: Semantic Document Search
use_cases.description: Implement intelligent search that understands meaning rather than just matching keywords across millions of documents.

use_cases.title: Smart Knowledge Bases
use_cases.description: Organize and retrieve information from vast knowledge repositories using natural language queries.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Vector Storage
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me store these research papers in AgentDB with vector embeddings for semantic search

prompt_templates.title: Similarity Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Query AgentDB to find documents similar to 'quantum computing breakthroughs' with 0.75 similarity threshold

prompt_templates.title: Hybrid Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search AgentDB for machine learning papers published after 2024 that are semantically similar to neural networks

prompt_templates.title: RAG Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a RAG pipeline using AgentDB that retrieves relevant context and generates answers about AI safety research

output_examples.input: Search for documents about climate change impacts

best_practices: Use binary quantization for 32x memory reduction when precision requirements allow
Set similarity threshold to 0.7 initially, then adjust based on your data quality needs
Enable HNSW indexing and caching for sub-millisecond search performance
anti_patterns: Don't store raw text without embeddings - always compute vectors for semantic search
Avoid single-vector inserts in loops - use batch operations for 500x better performance
Never use wrong dimension embeddings - match your database configuration to your model

faq.question: Which embedding models are compatible?
faq.answer: OpenAI ada-002 (1536 dims), sentence-transformers (768 dims), all-MiniLM-L6-v2 (384 dims), or any model with consistent dimensions.

faq.question: What's the maximum number of vectors I can store?
faq.answer: AgentDB efficiently handles 1M+ vectors. Use preset configurations (small/medium/large) based on your scale requirements.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing databases?
faq.answer: AgentDB works alongside existing databases. Store vector embeddings in AgentDB and reference original data IDs for hybrid queries.

faq.question: Is my data secure in AgentDB?
faq.answer: AgentDB stores data locally in SQLite files. No external network calls are made, and you maintain full control over your data.

faq.question: Why are my search results slow?
faq.answer: Ensure HNSW indexing is enabled (automatic in AgentDB), use appropriate similarity thresholds, and enable caching for frequently accessed patterns.

faq.question: How does this compare to Pinecone or Weaviate?
faq.answer: AgentDB offers comparable performance with 150x speed improvements, runs locally without API costs, and provides better quantization options.
